title: Trump revokes legal status for 530,000 Cubans, Haitians, Nicaraguans and Venezuelans
Former US Attorney Jessica Aber found dead in Virginia at 43
Israel strikes Lebanon after first rocket attack since ceasefire
description: Lebanon's health ministry says seven people, including a child, were killed and 40 injured.

title: Protesters in Turkey rally 'for justice' after mayor's arrest
description: Prosecutors request Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu's formal arrest on terrorism and corruption charges.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Heathrow Airport reopens after nearby fire — but travelers told to expect delays
description: British Airways said it expects around 85% of its Saturday Heathrow schedule to run as planned, but warned customers to expect delays.

title: Microsoft rallies in last 10 minutes of trading to avoid first eight-week losing streak since 2008
description: Microsoft faces competition in cloud computing from companies such as Google, which is looking to boost its security business with Wiz.

title: Pope Francis To Leave Hospital For Return To Vatican On Sunday
description: Pope Francis is to leave hospital on Sunday and return to his residence in the Vatican, where he is to spend "at least two months" recovering, one of his doctors announced.

title: What Columbia University Agreed To Do For $400m From Trump Administration
description: Columbia University's decision comes after the government pulled its funding earlier this month, citing allegations of antisemitism on campus.

title: Columbia University’s Concessions to Trump Seen as a Watershed - The New York Times
description: Columbia University’s Concessions to Trump Seen as a Watershed  The New York TimesColumbia University makes policy changes in dispute over federal funding  CNNColumbia caves to Trump’s demands for mask ban at protests and oversight after feds revoke $400M in funding  New York Daily NewsNYC education-politics: Reaction after Columbia University agrees to Trump administration demands to restore federal funding  ABC7 New YorkUsing funding to ‘force concessions’ threatens institutions, Princeton president says  PBS NewsHour

title: Former US Attorney Jessica Aber found dead in Virginia at 43 - ABC News
description: Former US Attorney Jessica Aber found dead in Virginia at 43  ABC NewsFormer US Attorney Jessica Aber, 43, found dead at Virginia residence: police  Fox NewsFormer US Attorney for Eastern District of Virginia — who stepped down in Jan. — found dead at 43: report  New York Post Former federal prosecutor found dead in Virginia home  CBS NewsFormer US attorney for Eastern Virginia dies at 43  WUSA9.com

title: Trump’s Attempts to Resolve Global Conflicts Quickly Face Diplomatic Reality
description: Allies say the foreign policy version of “flood the zone” is working. But critics argue that the hurry-up approach in Israel, Ukraine and Iran may not lead to stable, durable solutions to conflicts around the world.
author: Michael D. Shear

title: Pakistan Is Trying to Integrate the ‘Most Dangerous Place’ on Earth. It’s Failing.
description: The country’s former tribal areas bordering Afghanistan are plagued by escalating militancy, leading to widespread disillusionment.
author: Zia ur-Rehman

title: Sudan’s army recaptures presidential palace in major battlefield gain
description: Compound was last bastion in the capital, Khartoum, held by rival paramilitary Rapid Support ForcesThe Sudanese army has recaptured the presidential palace in the capital, Khartoum, in a highly symbolic battlefield victory over the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces in the country’s catastrophic civil war.Videos posted on social media showed soldiers carrying assault rifles and rocket-propelled grenade launchers inside the partly ruined building. An officer wearing a captain’s epaulettes announced the takeover of the palace in a video and confirmed that troops were inside the compound. Continue reading...
author: Carlos Mureithi in Nairobi and agencies

title: Power struggle leads to coup in Tigray as war looms between Ethiopia and Eritrea
description: Tigray’s interim leader flees as rival faction seizes control, while Ethiopian tanks and troops move to border of EritreaAregawi was building a tour-guiding business when war struck Ethiopia’s Tigray region in 2020. He spent the next two years fighting on the frontline. Now he is among those who fear Tigray is on the brink of conflict once more.“We don’t want to become a battleground, but it seems like war is near, maybe even inevitable,” he said. Continue reading...
author: Fred Harter in Addis Ababa

title: Israel launches airstrikes on Lebanon in largest attack since ceasefire
description: Israel launched airstrikes on multiple locations in Lebanon, killing at least six people in retaliation for a rocket attack. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu ordered strikes on Hezbollah targets, raising concerns about the fragile ceasefire. Hezbollah denied responsibility for the attack, and Lebanese leadership stressed they do not seek a return to war.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Fire breaks out at Walt Disney World's EPCOT French pavilion in Florida
description: A fire broke out backstage at the France Pavilion in EPCOT at Walt Disney World, causing no injuries. The blaze began in a walk-in cooler and was quickly extinguished. Videos on social media showed smoke rising as authorities continued their investigation during the busy Spring Break season.
author: TOI World Desk

title: IDF strikes Lebanon after rocket fire in biggest exchange of ceasefire
description: The Israel Defense Forces said it targeted “Hezbollah rocket launchers and a command center,” killing seven and wounding 40. Hezbollah denied launching rockets.
author: Mohamad El Chamaa, Susannah George, Victoria Bisset, Alon Rom

title: Pope Francis to be discharged from hospital Sunday, doctors say
description: “The pope will be released tomorrow,” said one of the pope’s attending physicians Saturday, after Francis spent five weeks battling a severe health crisis.
author: Anthony Faiola, Stefano Pitrelli
